intro: Chaenopleura parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered chaenopleura, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically produces small, pale pink to purple flowers that bloom in clusters during the warmer months. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
